intro: Dendranthema indicum var. acutum, commonly known as the sharp-leaved chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, serrated leaves and showy yellow to orange flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
